biography.value:
Nightmare beasts are enormous quadrupeds that stand 20 feet tall, or 40 feet tall when rearing on their hind legs.

A nightmare beast’s legs end in claws, enabling it to climb well despite its size. Its skin is thick and tough, and its teeth are long and sharp. A pair of long, curved tusks jut from the sides of the beast’s mouth, and its large red eyes glow in the dark. The creature smashes through structures and fortifications with ease, and it doesn’t hesitate to rend foes with its claws and gore them with its tusks, but its most devastating attack is its magical ability to disintegrate foes with its terrible gaze.

Powerful spellcasters create nightmare beasts to serve as living siege engines. A single beast can lay waste to entire cities and armies.

languages.custom: understands the languages of its creator but can’t speak

description.value:
The &Reference[beast]{beast} makes two Claw attacks and one Tusk attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d12 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save str 21 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[beast]{beast} targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must make a [[/save con 18 format=long]], taking [[/damage 10d6 + 40 type=force average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this magical effect reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is disintegrated and leaves nothing behind, except a pile of ashes plus whatever equipment it was wearing or carrying.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[beast]{beast} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The &Reference[beast]{beast} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Tusk Attack. The &Reference[beast]{beast} makes one Tusk attack.

Charge (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[beast]{beast} moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attack;opportunity attacks, then makes two Tusk attacks.

Frightful Howl (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[beast]{beast} howls as it exhales a cloud of magical fear gas in a 120-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Any creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save wis 18 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the &Reference[beast]{beast} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[beast]{beast} moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attack;opportunity attacks, then makes two Tusk attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[beast]{beast} howls as it exhales a cloud of magical fear gas in a 120-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Any creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save wis 18 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the &Reference[beast]{beast} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Legendary Resistance (2/Day). If the &Reference[beast]{beast} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Siege Monster. The &Reference[beast]{beast} deals double damage to objects and structures.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[beast]{beast} magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
